mh

Class VectorFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • mh.VectorFont

  • public class VectorFont
extends java.lang.Object
      Compact form of HP150 vector font.
 
  origin: at upper left of cell.
  x positive to the right
  y positive down
 
          'A'       '['    ...  example characters
  row
 10:   6:  o--- A---+   [[[[    --- umlauts
           |   A A  |   [       --- ascent
           |   A A  |   [
           |  A   A |   [
           |  AAAAA |   [       0 ... 6 = 7 nominal character height
           |  A   A |   [
  4:   0:  | _A__ A_|   [       ___ base line
           |    |   |   [       
      -2:  + ---+---+   [[[[    --- underline
  1:        01234567
  character height = 7
  character width = 5
  cell height: 9 (then '()[]{}/|[' on subsequent lines just touch)
  cell with: 8
  0x7f = 127 is a "pen up" code, the pen is lowered again at the next point
    Author:
    Martin Hepperle

      • setOrientation

        void setOrientation(int angle)
        The reference point for the rotation is at the baseline lower left corner of the character cell.
        Parameters:
        angle - 0 = horizontal to the right(0 deg)
        1 = vertical up (90 deg)
        2 = horizontal to the left (180 deg)
        3 =vertical down (270 deg)

      • dxTransformed

        private int dxTransformed(int dx,
                          int dy)
        Determine the x-coordinate of a point rotated in steps of 90 degrees. Uses the private variable m_angle. dxTransformed = dx*cos(phi) - dy*sin(phi) (Coordinate system: positive y = down)
        Parameters:
        dx - - The x coordinate of the point to transform.
        dy - - The y coordinate of the point to transform.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the transformed point.

      • dyTransformed

        private int dyTransformed(int dx,
                          int dy)
        Determine the y-coordinate of a point rotated in steps of 90 degrees. Uses the private variable m_angle. dyTransformed = -(dx*sin(phi) + dy*cos(phi)) (Coordinate system: positive y = down)
        Parameters:
        dx - - The x coordinate of the point to transform.
        dy - - The y coordinate of the point to transform.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the transformed point.
